reviewText:
First Impression Review

So I have a couple of hours under my belt in this new instalment and figured it's time to give you guys some feedback. I will update this later after a couple of full seasons.

Is this game fun? Yeah I would say so. If you like Motogp then it does what it needs to (just).

Is it much of an upgrade to Motogp 14? Nope, not really. Cosmetics and small tweaks only (so far).

Should the die-hard Motogp fans buy it? Absolutely, it has a nice feel to it and obviously it is updated with this seasons riders and such. It is still very much lacking in features that other driving sims have, hell even other sport games. But for the motogp series, it is slowly getting better...very slowly though.

Should casual players buy it? That depends on if they have any previous instalments of the game. If they have 2014 I would say no, wait for next year. It is another of those games that only get small adjustments each year so just buy every other one or grab it on a 50% sale later in the year. I do not honestly think It is worth shelling out all that cash each year for a casual player on a game that always seems much like it could just be a DLC to the previous year.

Pro's

The bikes seem to be a little bit more responsive this year in cornering(motogp at least), it is fun to leave some black lines out of corners and pull wheelies on the  moto3 bikes. Nothing you would really notice unless you have played motogp 14 within the last couple of days but it is there.

Slight wind wobble on the camera at high speeds, that seems to have been updated for this year and gives it a more realistic feel.

Custom bikes in career mode. It's not all singing and all dancing but it's about time we got this feature.

Seeing dry lines appear towards the end of a drying out qualifying session is nice. Yeah it may be 2015 and this should not be a surprise in this day and age but it still gave me a little lip curl.

Con's

The AI seem to fall off very easily if you bump them. I have noticed this while giving the game a try on medium AI so I will update this a little more when I try out the pro settings a little later.

It really isn't the best racing sim out there, it's more aimed at giving the motogp gearheads their fix for the year and making milestone some money. The same company also make Ride and the MXGP games and they are all pretty poor bike sims so dont get your hopes up for an amazing game.

My rider looks way too shiny in the wet. Graphics wise this game is still pretty poor, I don't see much of a difference on last years edition and some tracks look pretty empty.

Some strange sound effects... like crashing for instance, it just doesnt sound like it should.

--

All in all, Milestone need a good kick in the butt. Motogp still doesn't have a brilliant game like it should. If you like Motogp you will enjoy playing this game. It is not total crap like some would say but it is not much of an improvement on last year, just as last year was not much better than 2013. For me, it feeds my need for bike racing and as I said before, if you are a casual player, just buy it on a sale or every other year.

For what this game is, i would say 8/10 this year. Milestone need to try harder next year though.
Judged against other racing sims, pfft 6/10

I will recommend for now
--

reviewText:
So far so good, Ive been playing these moto gp games since gp 12, and I gotta say this was worth the money. it has all the updated riders for 2015, you can finally customize your own team, and bike which is fun to play around with, and there is a big difference between the handling in all the bikes, just like in real life. The ducati motorcycles are known for there power, but they are unstable. and the suzuk motorcycles have good handling, but down on power.

Overall Its a good good espically at this time being that its  a few bucks off original price.  RIDE was a good game but it had a good set of problems, even know there were more selctions of bikes the problems did not out weigh them. For instince the online racing has yet to be fixed from glitches, so after you play the story mode. (which will take about 60-70 hours) I was wanting to play in the onlime servers, but they were so glitchy, and there was only a total of like 10 people online so it was impossible to find a match. I was worried Moto gp would follow in the footsteps of ride, but I have NEVER experinced a glitch on moto gp 15, I had some timing problems when exiting the pit, but thats it.

Good buy, would recomend espically for the price.

reviewText: Fun game, definitely better than the previous ones in terms of performance, looks and amount of bugs. Handling is also a bit better and it isn't as forgiving as last year's game. Apart from that there's a few new game modes but nothing really spectacular.\n\nAll in all, if you already own MotoGP 13 or 14 I wouldn't consider it worth the £35 since you're basically getting a slightly less buggy and better looking reskin of 14. If, however this is your first Moto GP game, definitely pick it up. It has a really fun career mode which will keep you entertained for a long time and a bunch of other fun gamemodes if you get sick of career mode.

reviewText:
MotoGP™15 is a one of the many motorcycle racing game and, as it has also proven in 2015 edition, it is almost certainly the best game there is of this genre. If you're interested in racing games, be sure to have a look.
If this review is too long for you, I suggest you to only read the first paragraph about the game's content and the final verdict at the end.

What is happening in the game:As you probably know, the point of this game is to race and, if you're good enough, win the race. With diverse customisation, you are able to modify your vehicle just the way you want. There are a lot of tracks to drive on and also games modes, including instant race and championship. Well, it's exactly what you would expect from a racing game.

Pros:    I can't go past the graphics in my review. You might think that the screenshots are much better than the actual gameplay (as publishers usually make screenshots look astonishingly good), but in this case, the truth is not far behind. On several graphic options, from low to high, the game looked good.
The driving feels nice. I had some issues with controlling the vehicle (will be described in the Cons section), but when I fixed all the issues, my driving experience was excellent.
There are 18 tracks in this game and, as I understood, all of them are also a part of the real 2015 championship.
In case you need one, there is a pretty decent tutorial when you first start the game with the announcer guiding you through the game mechanics.
Some AAA companies these days are obsessed with DRM, but that doesn't seem to be the case in this game. You can freely play in offline mode any time you want.
Both your motorcycle and your outfit can be customisable with different colours, numbers and texts.
There are also different weather conditions.
Cons:    The controller is a driving device by default and the game wants it to stay this way. When I make the keyboard the default playing device, this setting is reset every time I turn on the game.
If you have a QWERTZ keyboard instead of QWERTY, as I do, you should know that this game detects Y, when you press Z. I had quite some problems with that, as the default braking key is Z and I couldn't even brake before I figured this out.
As I've heard, there is not much difference from this game and its ancestor (MotoGP 14).
Sometimes, bots fall of their bikes very quickly on contact. No biggie.
No MacOS and Linux support? Come on, we're not in the 19th century!
The final verdict:This game is awesome and, truth be told, I didn't expect anything else from an AAA game. Graphics are great, the feeling is great, the maps are great and controlling is great (after a few tweaks, if you have a keyboard). I had a lot of fun playing this and I don't consider myself the biggest fan of racing games. This game makes you excited when you play it even if you're not among the first on finish every time.
Buy it if you can. You won't be disappointed.

Greetings,
BirdCute

Note that my copy of this game was obtained for free for reviewing purposes. However, this did not affect the quality and objectivity of this review.

---
If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: Follow Original Curator Group

reviewText:
Jacko Rating
8.5/10
The best yet in the MotoGP series!
Graphics, audio and gameplay opitions all exceed the previous versions and the physics are not altered too much but rather just tweaked a little for the better.
If you have ever wanted to play a GP game on bikes then this is your best choice.  From the true to real life specs on all bikes and riders plus the TV style broadcast of the race this game gets as close as possible to actually having the opportunity to ride a real GP bike.
Create your rider and race him up through the ranks of Moto 3, Moto2 and finally MotoGP along the way negotiating contracts with teams or now you can start your own private team to compete with the big boys.
You are given rewards in the form of Photos of real life riders in action and HD Videos of the same as you win more and more races and level up.
To sum up a very accessable game for newbies to the genre and has enough tweaks and new additions to keep us MotoGP fans happy with the purchase of the latest addition to the franchise.
Nice Job!

reviewText:
As a MotoGP lover, this is a great game. This is my first MotoGP game I have played on PC, and runs easily at over 60 fps. The graphics are great and the bikes are very responsive. I have listed the main pros and cons below.

Pros:
Great graphics and textures
Easy to run
Bikes very responsive
The new Private Team" mode in carrer is great
AI improved
Quick loading times
Bike physics realistic

Cons:
Cal Crutchlow has to be unlocked at level 39
The unlocking system is stupid. The best riders are unlocked but the not so good riders and bikes have to be unlocked at high levels
Safety Car mode has been taken out"

reviewText:
Do not buy this game. If you had previous versions, it's the same game with rider updates.
Want to go through a full week end of racing and have fun? Ofcourse you do. Does Milestone think the same way? Ofcourse not, because F*ck you, they got your money. You want an example.
Set up your bike during practice and qualifying which happens to be dry weather. Warm ups and race in the rain.
Different year, same problem. During the warm up, they reset your settings. Good luck finding these or trying to load these, cause they've been saved under dry. Now you don't have a template.
12 mins to set up or find the template again, no thank you.
It's like watching Rossi raging because it's raining on race day and he has no set up, because his mechanic brought in a new bike. That always happens.

reviewText:
Being a motogp fan from day dot. The motogp series has always been worth a look at least. This version of motogp is one of the best so far over all.
Sure there are the odd niggle here and there , but i don't think I have ever played a perfect p.c game.

Considering motorcycling is not as main stream as car racing , no big company has reallly tackled motorbikes and racing to make a truly awsome masterpiece like grand turismo did etc. ... there was tourist trophy on Play station 2 but that was years ago and that game didn't have enough bikes really.
I sure hope someone will produce a true bike sim , something like 'Project Cars' on p.c where the physics / graphics and sound can all be pushed to the maximum.

The sound could be better in this game considering we are in the year 2015. Over all though i would recommend this game to anyone who likes racing motorcycles and motogp. The graphics are great! the physics are not all too bad and the sense of speed and the smoothness of the game have been greatly improved.
The Rider animations have been improved on - now the Riders head moves properly in the turn and there is even more body movement - what this does is it gives you more scope to push every last drop of performance out of the bikes.

The edition of the old 990 cc Motogp fourstrokes dlc was a good idea , i loved thoses bikes when they came out and milestone has made a good model for these monster race bikes.
Also of note , there is a good difference between the years of the bikes in power and handling and in this version of the motogp game ALL bikes go really fast and are quite aggressive . In simulation mode it is easyer to highside the motorcycle.

As of writing this, i have put in well over 24 hours with this game and it still feels like I hav't scratched the surfice of the depth of the game as there are a lot of bikes and riders in this game.


Hey Milestone ! .... how about and upgraded version of your World Superbikes Race game sim. Ride shows that superbikes could be quite popular.

Graphics 8/10
Sound  5/10
Physics 8/10
longevity 8/10
Fun 9/10
Realism 8/10

reviewText: I haven't played previous MotoGP titles. So, I am highly impressed and recommend this game IF" you like to play in first person view with no riding aids. There are always room for improvements
date: specially on the visual quality. But despite all the critisism Milestone developers get
recommended: they are indeed the masters of simulating motorcycle racing successfully. As they are the handful of guys creating such games
hoursPlayed:
I am thankful to that :)

PROS-
- Handling is near perfect and refined. Physics feels really good as you progress from lower classes to higher ones. Handling is challanging but still fun.
- Visually not that demanding and looks decent at fluid 60fps.
- The game has high replay value. I find mastering corners and improving time in time attack mode quite satisfying. After nearly 80hrs
voteText:
I am still about to start in moto2 from moto3 in career mode on simulation difficulty.
- AI is quite good and competitive to play offline. Online community is quite challanging as well.
- motogp madness experience...visually :) Loved the included multimedia videos as well

CONS (so to say)-
- It feels as if the PC version is not a priority and has been ported from ps4 version. Visually it can be more refined.
- Online latency can be an issue sometimes. Also lobby rules and structure can be improved. Things like showing time left for qualifying sessions
helpfulPercent: ability to join qualifying in progress
votesHelpful:
skipping session and host transfer can be very helpful.
- Inaccurate leaderboards. Times way lower than real records takes away the sim factor :P

Both "Ride" and "motogp" are good games. I play these games with xbox controller and have my G27 eating dust since I bought these. VR might change that. So I hope Milesone are also working on next version of their games with driveclub quality graphics and VR support."

reviewText:
Finally a decent MotoGP game from Milestone.

It seems like they actually listen to the feed back on their previous releases.
The visuals of the bikes/riders and track is great now.

Gameplay and physics are the best they've been for awhile, though there still appears to be some traction/wheelie control even when you have it turned off.

Downsides is that it crashes fairly often, say every 2-3 sessions it would crash...
Sound is ok but still miss some of the great audio of early MotoGP games (before Milestone)
DLC is a waste of time and money.

But given i've been dissapointed year after year, this is actually a nice surprise.

reviewText: Bought this last year and have tried it on various occasions, but now binned it and re-installed Moto13. Too many glitches, bad running (sometimes can't even get out of the game, and I've got newish running gear) and where on earth did Milestone get the bike sounds from? have they not actually gone to a motogp or superbike race. Started playing Motogp way back in the 2000s and I am sorry to say that since Milestone took over from THQ, the game has gone downhill, and is now floundering and is sometimes unplayable. Sad really because I am a big fan on Motogp.

would continue in their efforts of finishing this title and more in the future as I understand how much time and effort it takes to produce and with its potential could have been the best MotoGP game ever but not as of yet.

reviewText:
MotoGP14 was an epic game on my PS4, hours of fun working myself up to the MotoGP League...won the Moto3, the Moto2 and the MotoGP...one of the few games i had a 100% Archivement outcome after more then 20 hours of fun...

now playing MotoGP15 and being surrounded by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.
The engine is BADLY made...FPS-Drops here and there and really badly...nothing i should have with a i5-6500 and a GTX 980 Ti with 16GB DDR4 on my Mainboard....even with all Details on low and only running it on HD, doesn't matter if V-Sync is On or Off it does not go away...

but thats still something i could handle...but now i'm at a point i just wanna vomit....
The T1-T4 Races. Made for you to earn TechPoints to upgrade your Bike. Really helpful that you CAN'T skip that ♥♥♥♥ even tho you already got all Parts on Level 3. And if you just can't beat the time cuz you alway 0,200 seconds behind the goal-time guess what...you have to wait ♥♥♥♥in 60 Minutes Realtime cuz you can't cancel the race or skip it (well you can....by retreat from the WHOLE SEASON!!!)

The Guy who had that game mechanic comming up his mind must be a real genius. Genius enough to not make myself put any money into any MotoGP anymore. Even more saddening after i had so much fun with MotoGP14 and Ride.

No idea why developers think its a cool thing to downgrade their gamequality with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t gameplay decision.

For me i decided not to wait ♥♥♥♥in 60 Realtime Minutes and to throw the game into the trashbin. Farewell Milestone.

reviewText:
Crash and MotoGp can't be separated, Both in real life and in games. With MotoGP15 you can truly experience the adrenaline rush of seeing your unresponsive game freeze and crash. You are stuck and can't progress in this game.

Knowing your game is litterred with bugs, I just dont have the effort to go look for a solution. Can I get a refund? NO.

11/10 would crash again with MotoGP16.
voteText: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
My first and only MotoGP game was : MotoGP 11, and it was my only motorcycling game ever for that matter.

I loved it. The driving experience, the way to surf in the turns, MotoGP really provides a unique sensation of driving.

That sensation is still here in MotoGP 15. Great !

But, I remember in MotoGP 11 (on PS3) the very nice skies..., that is gone. No matter the sky condition you set (except for sunny) you end up with that boring exact same grey on cloudy, raining, lightly raining... no difference. No more of those beautiful sunbeams shining through the very nice big and scary clouds.

The Bike and some aspects of the tracks may look better, but might be only due to higher resolution.

Multiple bugs... from sound bugs, making you stuck with the ugly startup line's engines for the whole race, to the ones making it impossible to properly go back in time : if you fell, and want to rewind, you can, except that sometimes, you'll automaticaly fell back as soon as you reset it... and you are not able to rewind again after that of course.

At the end of the day,
I really enjoy MotoGP for the great driving and racing sensations, but it is in no way a game worth it's full price, it looks quite unfinished in some aspects. And I can't shake the idea that the 11 on PS3 gived a better visual experience than this one. Bying it at half price is a good compromise.

reviewText: Im not exactly sure what to think really. Do I consider it fun... Yea, but only kind of! I remember the first MotoGP on the OG XBox being a lot more fun and in debth when it came to setting up your bike. I am not exactly sure what to say about this game exept that is an average racer. There is nothing exciting about it. Although the game is fun, it is a dull kind of fun if that makes any sense. There are sooo many things that you can do to this game to put it over the top to make it a one of a kind bike racer unlike any other! Everything about Moto GP 16 is just to freakin average. I haven't played any of this games predicessors other than the every first one and that was years ago. I do not need to play any of the older games in the series though... Me thinking that the very FIRST game in the line up is better than the 15th game in the line up says a lot.\n\nDon't even get me started on the custom logo gag. Yup... GAG! There are only a few custom" pre-rendered logos to choose from and they are some of the lamest logos that I have ever seen! I have seen high school logos with better appeal... Even worse... I have seen little league logos that ot class the lame cartoony logos of Moto GP 16! Custom logos was a big selling point for me when I was considering to buy this game. I am a graphic designer and I was hoping to God that I would be able to upload my very own custom logos
date: but nope! I'll say it again
recommended: the logos pffered in this game are horrible... HORRIBLE!!! YUK!!! A cartoon shark... C'mon man... Really?\n\nI haven't gotten far enough into the game to really experience the "custom" livery selection yet
hoursPlayed: but I am afraid that if they are comparable to the logos I am in trouble! Moto GP 1 offered some extremely cool liveries for the bikes and the gear. All of which you could manipulate the color scheme any way you wanted. Not just one color of one part of the pattern
voteText: but every color of the pattern. Enabling you to create several million different color combinations! It was highly unlikely to see anyone with the same color scheme and pattern wehn you raced online... Everyones was different... All of the time!\n\nOnline racing was also spot on in Moto GP 1. I haven't raced online with 15 yet
helpfulPercent: but I hope it is just as good. In 1 you could take your custom bile with your custom set up and race with it. If you are stuck racing a prefabed bike online I will be extremely dissapointed. If this is the case I will hang it up and put this game in the virtual garbage. So far
votesHelpful: it looks as if the game is already on its way there... Lets hope not!"

reviewText: MotoGP15 is a good game if you like racing. The graphics are good and it's very animated, and there is a lot of racing.  This game is the better of all the MotoGP racing game out there, so buy it if you are into racing MotoGP.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Wow. What a fantastic game. If you're into racing (watching F1 etc.) but you haven't played any serious games (I had invested serious time into arcade racing like the need for speed series) then you're in for a treat. Graphics are excellent. The tutorial is helpful. The career mode is compelling. All of the detailing in the game goes a long way. I really liked the race engineer. During your race weekend, when in the pits, you can speak with an engineer about the handling of the bike and he will suggest tuning a particular way to solve certain issues. It's a really fantastic way of teaching an inexperienced player which variables affect which characteristics. I'd recommend playing with the physics on pro but leaving the racing line on until you get the hang of it.

reviewText: Well this game could be so fun. And I do enjoy it, but playing with a gamepad or keyboard is almost impossible.  I need some settings for game pad to adjust dead zone as well as sensitivity.  Even if I partially push the stick left or right its all or nothing in steering.  This makes it very difficult to play with any kind of realism.   I know that won't ever be patched in so be mindful if you buy this game.  As far as graphics and gameplay though it is solid.

reviewText: As expected the content is very similar to the previous games so a lengthy review is unecessary. I assume most people genuinly interested in this title would have played the previous games as well. However the game runs smoothly as I've had no game crashes and my framerate is fully stable on medium settings.Visually it looks good, I always race with a helmet cam so how pretty the trees are does not concern me. In terms of physics the game is more forgiving than MotoGP 14. In some respects I really miss the challenging physics of Milestone's early SBK games, however this is still challenging enough. It's a quality product.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I'm an FPS, RPG and Story driven games fan.

Mechanics are awesome. Controls for someone who just got into this type of game is a bit difficult, but after you get use to it, it's a blast. Could have used a bit more animation scenes before/after the race and mre cosmetics for your racer, but it's good for what it has as well.

Difficulty? Well, lets just say I was so happy that after a few hours of trying I started getting better at the game, and taking 1st places just to learn that the AI is set to Very Easy and I've been always playing with assist mechanic, meaning it automatically slowers my bick on corners and thucks for extra speed when I don't need to do any turns.

In other words, the game is well worth the price and if you're a fan of racing games, then you'll most likely enjoy this one too.

reviewText: Good game, graphically this game is a HUGE step up from 2014 and is with the times now. As someone who rides motorcycles, the physics are solid. Its very similar to game Ride" by them as well

reviewText: MotGP 15 is quite amazing as there's not so much choice by bike sim racers. This game is way better than Ride. A lot of people recommend using an xbox controller, which is really good with this type of games, But I want you people to know that there's an even better controller  that particularly suits well bike racing games. I use a THRUSTMASTER FREESTYLER BIKE (PC version) to play this game. They are not produced anymore and are sometimes listed on eBay. If you can find one please buy it. It will enhance your bike racing experience.
